rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable DM.USUBJID

datasetVariables.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.
datasetVariables.label: Unique Subject Identifier
datasetVariables.name: USUBJID

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable DM.SUBJID

datasetVariables.description: Subject (i.e., Animal) identifier used within the study.
datasetVariables.label: Subject Identifier for the Study
datasetVariables.name: SUBJID

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable DM.RFSTDTC

datasetVariables.description: Reference start date/time for the subject in ISO 8601 format. Usually equivalent to date/time when subject was first exposed to study treatment. Study day calculation (the --DY variable) in all domains will be based on this date. The sponsor must define what collected date is used to populate RFSTDTC in the data definition file.
datasetVariables.label: Subject Reference Start Date/Time
datasetVariables.name: RFSTDTC

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable DM.RFENDTC

datasetVariables.description: Reference end date/time for the subject in ISO 8601 format. Usually equivalent to the date/time when the subject was determined to have left the study. The sponsor must define what collected date is used to populate RFENDTC in the data definition file.
datasetVariables.label: Subject Reference End Date/Time
datasetVariables.name: RFENDTC

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable DM.RFXSTDTC

datasetVariables.description: First date/time of exposure to any protocol-specified treatment or therapy, equal to the earliest value of EXSTDTC. Note: Absolute first.
datasetVariables.label: Date/Time of First Study Treatment
datasetVariables.name: RFXSTDTC

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable DM.RFXENDTC

datasetVariables.description: Last date/time of exposure to any protocol-specified treatment or therapy, equal to the latest value of EXENDTC (or the latest value of EXSTDTC if EXENDTC was not collected or is missing). Note: Absolute last
datasetVariables.label: Date/Time of Last Study Treatment
datasetVariables.name: RFXENDTC

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable DM.SITEID

datasetVariables.description: Unique identifier for a study site within a submission. Use only if subjects are housed at different sites.
datasetVariables.label: Study Site Identifier
datasetVariables.name: SITEID

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable DM.BRTHDTC

datasetVariables.description: Date/Time of birth of the subject, in ISO 8601 format.
datasetVariables.label: Date/Time of Birth
datasetVariables.name: BRTHDTC

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable DM.AGE

datasetVariables.description: May be derived (RFSTDTC - BRTHDTC), but BRTHDTC may not be available in all cases. Age may also be collected.
datasetVariables.label: Age
datasetVariables.name: AGE

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable DM.AGETXT

datasetVariables.description: Used when the age is a range and the exact birthdate is not known. This variable is a character field for the purposes of defining age ranges, e.g., if the information available for the age of the subject is 6-8 and AGEU is WEEKS. Populate only when BRTHDTC or AGE is not specified. The format for AGETXT is "number-number" (e.g., 6-8).
datasetVariables.label: Age Range
datasetVariables.name: AGETXT

datasetVariables.description: Units associated with AGE and AGETXT.
datasetVariables.label: Age Unit

datasetVariables.description: The sex of the subject.
datasetVariables.label: Sex

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable DM.SPECIES

datasetVariables.description: If this variable is excluded in the DM domain, the information must be present at a higher level (either Trial Sets or Trial Summary).
datasetVariables.label: Species
datasetVariables.name: SPECIES

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C77530

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable DM.STRAIN

datasetVariables.description: Used to identify the vendor-supplied strain, substrain, or breed designation for the test system under study. It may combine the background strain, substrain, and associated genetic modifications as supplied by the vendor (e.g., C57BL/6, A/J, B6.129-Pparg<tm2Rev>/J, FISCHER 344, SPRAGUE-DAWLEY IGS, WISTAR Kyoto, BEAGLE, CYNOMOLGUS, and CHIMPANZEE). The SEND Controlled Terminology codelist consists of commonly used wild type strains. It is extensible to accommodate strains not listed and genetically modified substrains. If this variable is excluded in the DM domain, the information must be present at a higher level (either Trial Sets or Trial Summary). Country of origin for non-human primates should not go into STRAIN. In general, details related to coat color (e.g., White and Red designations for New Zealand Rabbits) should not go into STRAIN.
datasetVariables.label: Strain/Substrain
datasetVariables.name: STRAIN

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable DM.SBSTRAIN

datasetVariables.description: Free-text field that allows the sponsor to enter further details qualifiying the SPECIES and/or STRAIN, depending on the level to which these variables were defined. Examples include the description of a specific genetic alteration, country of origin for non-human primates, details related to coat color (e.g., White and Red designations for New Zealand Rabbits), and important animal husbandry information (e.g., SPF, BR, VAF).
datasetVariables.label: Strain/Substrain Details
datasetVariables.name: SBSTRAIN

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable DM.ARMCD

datasetVariables.description: Short name for ARM (may be up to 20 characters) used for sorting and programming. Should be populated when Arms have been defined in the TA domain.
datasetVariables.label: Planned Arm Code
datasetVariables.name: ARMCD

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable DM.ARM

datasetVariables.description: Descriptive name given to a specific Trial Arm (e.g., Low Dose, Mid Dose, 10 mg/kg/day dose, Third Arm) to which the subject was assigned.
datasetVariables.label: Description of Planned Arm
datasetVariables.name: ARM

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable DM.SETCD

datasetVariables.description: Short name of a specific Trial Set to which the subject was assigned, as defined by the sponsor. Maximum of 8 characters. This represents the Trial Set for which parameters are being submitted.
datasetVariables.label: Set Code
datasetVariables.name: SETCD

description: A special-purpose domain that includes a set of essential standard variables that describe each subject in a clinical study. It is the parent domain for all other observations for human clinical subjects. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, SDOMAIN, C49572, 2018-06-29)
label: Demographics
name: DM
